item.title: Best Easter Eggs in Metal Gear Solid Delta Snake Eater
item.description:
Metal Gear Solid Delta Snake Eater retains the original identity of Kojima's Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater with every pixel. Design, characters, and gameplay are all near-identical, albeit with a modern uplift. With such identical renditions, it's expected of Metal Gear Solid Delta Snake Eater to have the same easter eggs as the original, but that doesn't make them any less cool. Below, players can take a look at some of the best easter eggs and secrets in Metal Gear Solid Delta Snake Eater , along with how to find them in their own game and what makes them so cool to witness first-hand.

Huey Emmerich & the Origin of Metal Gears

An Iconic Ally of Snake and the Metallic Beasts That Show How War Has Changed

When Snake infiltrates a research facility in search of Sokolov, he comes across Granin, a proud man who scoffs at Sokolov's creation. Grainin's dreams are grandiose and entirely dangerous. Once Snake meets him, they can investigate his office with their own eyes, where they will see statues of Metal Gears yet to be created, like Metal Gear Ray. There are also blueprints to other Metal Gears, but even more alarming is a photo of Granin with his American ally, Huey Emmerich. Not only is this the father of Otacon, but it's the man who helped craft the Metal Gears, and someone who Big Boss would eventually have a complicated alliance in later years.

A Whole Clan of Johnnies

A Family of IBS Suffering Men Named Johnny

Once players reach their holding cell after a cutscene in Volgin's torture room, they will be stuck until they find a way to escape. However, feel free to linger a little while longer, as the lone guard will occasionally throw food into the cell. If Snake equips the food from his backpack and throws it out of his cell 3 times, the guard will talk to Snake and begin a secret cutscene where he reveals his origin as an American with a wife and kid. This man reveals himself to be Johnny, and then reveals that the firstborn sons in his family are all called Johnny. His father's a Johnny, his son's a Johnny, and his son's son will be a Johnny. This rings true, for every game in the series features a character called Johnny who defecates at inappropriate times, providing some light-hearted toilet humor.

Snake's Nightmare

Unlock the Secret Guy Savage Minigame

Players can learn a little bit more about Snake when they enter his prison cell after being tortured by Volgin. All they need to do is call the Para-Medic's save codec, where she will begin to talk about the vampire Dracula. Snake is revealed to be terrified of vampires, and if players reload the save they just created, they will be loaded into an entirely separate game, referred to as Guy Savage. This mode is completely separate from what's been played before, and has players take on a hack-and-slash adventure against vampires and coffin monsters. The gameplay is a lot of fun, so it's definitely worth trying out for players who have yet to experience the truth of Snake's Nightmare.

Making Snake Puke & Catch a Cold

Harass Snake in the Cure Menu to Make Him Suffer Even More

There are clever ways to torture Snake that don't have direct impacts on his health and create a game-over paradox. Players can actually make Snake vomit if they enter the Cure menu and decide to spin him with the analog stick for over 10 times. The same can be done once players have EVA as an ally in the final segments of the game. Not only can players force Snake to puke up his dinner, but they can also make him catch the common cold by having him stand in the rain or water for around 30 minutes while in his Naked camouflage, which will see him sneeze and sniffle.

The Raikov/Raiden Connection

Metal Gear Solid 2's Controversy Lives On in 1964

Metal Gear Solid 2 might be beloved now, but the game's release in 2001 saw some controversy with its subversion of expectations. The protagonist of MGS2 was not the beloved Solid Snake, but instead a new character, Raiden, whom most players at the time saw as whiny and annoying. With Metal Gear Solid 3 coming soon after, the developers realized people's lack of love for Raiden, and decided to make fun of him by making Raikov look identical to Raiden. In the locker where players hide Raikov's body, is also a poster of MGS2 with Raiden on the cover, and selecting "I love MGS2 !" before the game starts, Snake will be wearing a Raiden mask.

Torturing The End

There Are a Few Ways to Bully a Century-Old Man

The End is the greatest sniper to have ever lived, and his 100+ years on this Earth prove just that. However, Snake can commit some forms of elder abuse if he so feels like it. The first time players meet the End, he's in his wheelchair. Players can use a weapon to kill the End early in this segment before he escapes, which will result in no boss fight, and Snake getting his by a wheelchair's rogue exploding wheel. That's not all players can do, as even in the End's boss fight, they can eat his loyal parrot, hold him up for a unique camouflage, or save the game in his boss fight, skip time for a week, and then return to find his corpse where he would've died from old age.

Becoming Volgin's Lover

A Keen Disguise Makes Volgin Suffer as He Has Made Others Suffer

In order to rescue Sokolov in the latter half of the game, players will need to kidnap Major Raikov and use a disguise to look exactly like him. While Colonel Volgin sees through this disguise because of the size of Snake's crotch not being the same as Raikov's, it seems that Volgin isn't able to use the same crotch-grabbing tactic in the middle of a battle. If players re-equip the Raikov disguise during the Volgin boss fight, Volgin will drop to his knees and mourn for his lover. It's a fun easter egg that not only allows players to get in some free and cheap damage, but also shows the deeper secrets to manipulate boss fights.

Ocelot is Everywhere

Secret R1 Cutscenes Show Ocelot's Importance Across Nations

In one of the final cutscenes of the game, players can hit R1 while being greeted by the U.S. President to look to the left, where Snake's eye will spot Revolver Ocelot, shooting them one last point to prove that he's everywhere. Not only is this a fun and creepy easter egg, but it also shows deeper meaning within Ocelot's importance. Ocelot truly is everywhere, and his actions as a triple agent couldn't be clearer as he stalks Big Boss from the shadows. For future entries, this easter egg shows how deeply Ocelot respects Snake, and how he would be his most loyal soldier from here on out.

item.title: Schedule 1 Players Can Once Again Vote on the Game's Next Update
item.description:
After the recent launch of the title's big cartel patch, Schedule 1 developer TVGS is once again allowing players to vote for the game's next major content update. The first Schedule 1 community vote gave players the opportunity to choose between three update options: the cartel, shrooms, or a police expansion. As players will be well aware, the cartel update emerged victorious, but now it's time for the community to decide which content should be added next.

Alongside titles such as R.E.P.O . and Peak , Schedule 1 has cemented itself as one of the biggest indie games of the year. In its first few days, the crime simulation title reached a peak of nearly 460,000 concurrent players on Steam, making it one of the most popular games on the platform. Since then, Schedule 1 has received a steady stream of new updates from its solo developer, Tyler, to keep players engaged. The latest patch was only released just a few days ago, but the dev is now once again calling on players to decide what Schedule 1 's next update should be.

Schedule 1 Players Can Vote for the Game's Next Update

Schedule 1 's cartel update was highly requested by players in the first community vote, and it's now time for fans to choose what should be added to the game next. In a new post on Steam, TVGS has revealed that the second community vote is now live until the weekend. Once again, players will be able to vote for one of three new updates via the Schedule 1 main menu. This time around, the community will be voting between hireable drivers, fishing, and shrooms. The latter of which was previously available in the first community vote earlier this year.

If players choose to vote for hireable drivers, the update will add a new employee to Schedule 1 that can transport items between a player's properties, businesses, and dealers. Players will also be able to designate automatic transit routes and specify the required conditions, such as the number of items in the vehicle, for a route to begin. As for fishing, the update will add a new minigame where players can reel in fish and sell them at Randy's Bait & Tackle. TVGS says the update would also add several new ingredients and effects to the game.

Finally, the shrooms update would allow players to manufacture and distribute a brand new drug type - Magic Mushrooms. TVGS says the patch would add a new drug, unique equipment, new effects, and a new supplier to Schedule 1 .

item.title: Best JRPGs On Sale This Week (September 1–7)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best PS5 JRPGs Deals
  • Best Xbox JRPGs Deals
  • Best Nintendo Switch JRPGs Deals
  • Best Steam JRPGs Deals

Japanese role-playing games have been a staple of the industry since the mid-80s, and the genre's relevance and popularity have not declined. Once upon a time, quite a few of these projects were hard to come by outside of Japan; however, nowadays, that is no longer the case. Not only do most projects make their way to North America, but they are also available on a range of platforms, rather than being exclusive to PlayStation. Most importantly, if you are willing to wait, you can take advantage of some great JRPG deals .

Except for Steam, most digital stores do not have dedicated sections for JRPGs, instead opting to include all RPGs under one bracket. As such, it can be difficult to see exactly which games are on sale. So, let's simplify that process by covering the PS5, Xbox, Switch, and Steam JRPGs that are currently discounted.

Here are some notes and criteria:

  • Only digital stores: PlayStation Store, Xbox Store, Nintendo Store, and Steam.
  • To be included, a deal must be available for at least 24 hours after this article's publication.
  • If a deal ends before September 7, the date will be included.
  • If a deal lasts the full week, no date will be listed.
  • These sales are based on North American stores, and things may vary in other regions.
  • New deals might become available as the week progresses.

Best PS5 JRPGs Deals

Final Fantasy, Kingdom Hearts, Infinite Wealth, Legend of Heroes, & More

  • PlayStation Store Deals Page

Out of the main digital platforms, the PlayStation Store has the best range of JRPG deals for this week, covering quite a few major franchises and subgenres. While perhaps not as well-known as some other IPs, The Legend of Heroes is generally regarded as one of the most consistent JRPG series of all time, and pretty much all the franchise's recent releases are on sale. A couple of Final Fantasy games are discounted, including the PS4's X/X-2 HD Remaster compilation. If you have never played those turn-based classics and want to buy something that will keep you busy for quite a long time, this deal is worth checking out. Alternatively, you can just get Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5 + 2.5 ReMIX .

Two of the best JRPGs of 2024, Metaphor: ReFantazio and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth , are as cheap as they have ever been on the PS5, and they are both lengthy and ambitious masterpieces. For anyone craving a dungeon crawler, Labyrinth of Galleria: The Moon Society is a great option. Tactics fans can check out Disgaea or The DioField Chronicle .

  • Crisis Core -Final Fantasy VII- Reunion -Digital Deluxe Edition – $27.99
  • Disgaea 1 Complete (PS4) – $19.99
  • Disgaea 4 Complete+ (PS4) – $19.99
  • Dragon Star Varnir (PS4) – $8.99
  • Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes – $17.49
  • Fairy Fencer F: Refrain Chord – $9.99
  • Final Fantasy Type-0 HD (PS4) – $7.99
  • Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster (PS4) – $9.99
  • Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade – $15.19
  • I Am Setsuna (PS4) – $11.99
  • Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5 + 2.5 ReMIX (PS4) – $19.99
  • Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8 Final Chapter Prologue (PS4) – $23.99
  • Labyrinth of Refrain: Coven of Dusk (PS4) – $14.99
  • Labyrinth of Galleria: The Moon Society – $19.99
  • Langrisser I & II (PS4) – $17.49
  • Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth – $27.99
  • Live a Live – $19.99
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio – $38.49

  • Persona 4 Golden (PS4) – $9.99
  • Romancing SaGa -Minstrel Song- Remastered – $12.49
  • SaGa Emerald Beyond – $24.99

  • The DioField Chronicle – $23.99
  • The Legend of Heroes: Trails from Zero (PS4) – $27.99
  • The Legend of Heroes: Trails to Azure (PS4) – $27.99
  • The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel III – $27.99
  • The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel IV – $27.99
  • The Legend of Heroes: Trails into Reverie – $35.99
  • The Legend of Heroes: Trails through Daybreak – $41.99
  • Trials of Mana (PS4) – $19.99
  • Valkyrie Elysium - Digital Deluxe Edition – $29.99
  • Valkyrie Profile: Lenneth – $9.99

  • Ys IX: Monstrum Nox – $29.99

If you have a PS Plus subscription, please double-check whether you have access to a game before buying it.

Best Xbox JRPGs Deals

Triangle Strategy & WitchSpring R

  • Xbox Store Deals Page

At the moment, the Xbox Store's JRPG sales selection is a bit lacking, as most deals are set to expire by the end of September 1. Microsoft might reveal new discounts after that point, but that is not guaranteed. We also have no way to know if JRPGs will be included.

  • Triangle Strategy – $41.99 (September 3)
  • WitchSpring R – $25.99 (September 7

Best Nintendo Switch JRPGs Deals

Persona, Shin Megami Tensei, Tales, Digimon, & More

  • Nintendo Store Sales & Deals Page

Switch owners are eating well this week, at least if their preferred meal involves JRPGs. While no native Switch 2 JRPGs are discounted, many of its predecessor's titles are on sale, and they should be playable on the newer system.

In terms of subgenres, turn-based JRPGs deals are plentiful, with Persona 3 Portable , Shin Megami Tensei V , Digimon Story Cyber Sleuth , The Legend of Heroes , and Baten Kaitos I & II HD Remaster being some of the highlights. If you are more into action JRPGs, you can pick up multiple Tales games, along with Tokyo Xanadu eX+ , Ys VIII , and even some Sword Art Online titles.

  • .hack//G.U. Last Recode – $9.99

  • Ys Origin – $4.99

Best Steam JRPGs Deals

Granblue Fantasy, Metaphor: ReFantazio, Like a Dragon, & More

  • Steam JRPG Page

Steam and sales are synonymous, with Valve's store nearly always promoting a few substantial deals. Currently, Steam's JRPG deals are pretty solid, although they are not particularly plentiful. Many of Atlus' games will be on sale until September 4, and they are consistently high quality. Granblue Fantasy: Relink was one of the best action JRPGs of 2024, and Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii is one of the best action JRPGs of 2025. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is also on sale, although it is only 10% cheaper than usual. While only inspired by JRPGs, the 2025 game is so beloved that we just have to mention it.

item.title: The Berlin Apartment - Official Release Date Trailer
item.description: Take a look at the official release date trailer for The Berlin Apartment, a story-driven game where players witness the lives of numerous people over the course of the century.

item.title: Comix Zero - Official Gameplay Trailer
item.description: Comix Zero is a beat 'em up roguelike metroidvania set inside the pages of a comic book. See the official gameplay trailer here.
